revised_title: Anatomical Study of Nerve-Muscle Relations in Aquatic Larva of Tipula crystallina
tldr: This study examines the relationship between nerves and muscular structures in the aquatic larva of Tipula crystallina. The author describes two types of nerve terminations, flabelliform and stapiform, and observes no union between granular contents and sarcous elements. The research also highlights the importance of blood-corpuscles and their role in the movement of living matter.
